tool.name: Check for lost reads
tool.description: verify starting read number = read number in both G1 and G2 SAM files.

param.name: alnSum1
param.label: Alignment Summary 1
param.help: The G1 alignment summary file containing all read types [Required]

param.name: alnSum2
param.label: Alignment Summary 2
param.help: The G2 alignment summary file containing all read types [Required]

param.name: fq
param.label: Name of the FASTQ file
param.help: Name of FQ to be used in alignments

data.name: out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Check start readNum = alignment readNum

tool.help:
**Tool Description**
This tool verifies that all reads in a FASTQ file are present in the SAM files generated by aligning to the G1 genome and G2 genomes.
**Input**
(1) The output summary TSV file generated from the BWA Split SAM script on the G1 SAM file (2) The output summary TSV file generated from the BWA Split SAM script on the G2 SAM file (3) The FASTQ file using to generate the above G1 and G2 SAM files - used to calculate the number of starting reads
**Output**
(1) A TSV file containing: (1) starting read counts in the FASTQ file [start_read_num] (2) read counts in the G1 alignment [readNum_G1] (3) read counts in the G2 alignment [readNum_G2] (4) indicator flag for whether the starting count = G1 count [flag_start_readNum_eq_readNum_G1] (5) indicator flag for whether the starting count = G2 count [flag_start_readNum_eq_readNum_G2]
